text:
The food is decent and service is friendly. The menu and pricing are on par with Roberto's Taco Shop. There's also a clean salsa bar with the basics for adding extra zing if you need it.

My favorite order to date has to be the super nachos. It's basically a whole mess of meat, guacamole, pico de gallo, sour cream and beans over crispy chips. Warning: You may want to share these or you'll be unbuttoning those jeans. 

They have a Taco Tuesday special of $0.99 per taco (chicken & potato only). 

A good little hole in the wall if you're in the mood for a quick Mexican fix and are in the area.
the best taco place ever ever time I eat there they are nice and their food is amazing especially their burrito

Make sure you check you order before you leave. Everytime (x4) I ask to add sourcream, which costs an extra $1.20 for a spoonful, it's never on it & they forget the guacamole too. Then I tell them no pico on the next order, they write no pico on the burrito and guess what.......there's pico. Simple things to ask for, so never going back.

So I work at night and the days that I'm off I used to like to come here to eat whenever I didn't want to cook.  I'm not sure when they changed their hours because I've made several attempts to go there and if it's anytime after midnight it's been closed.  It's irritating though, that they still advertise themselves as open 24/7.

Horrible food! They reheat their meats by adding oil. The guy at the counter never said hello, thank you or smiled once. After we sat down the guy at the counter and one of the guys in the back started wrestling around on the floor. A la lucha libre. The salsa bar was nasty and dirty.
Super burrito is so much better.
The food isn't bad price is ok the salsa bar isn't good well not all the time they need some with a little more spice the green I had today was like flavored water

Carne Asada French Fries!!! Awesome.
The Staff is super friendly!

The sign on the door says "Laurita's Taco Shop". They have tacos. They have shrimp...but you can't have shrimp tacos. Huh??!! The guy taking my order looked at me like I had three heads. Still scratching my head. On to the next Mexican restaurant that can accommodate a simple request.

Why dont the hundreds of happy customers ever write in. This is the spot. Ten pm Sunday night. Music is playing guys in the back chopping up all the fixings all fresh. My California burrito is hot fresh n delicious.  There's never a bad burrito from this place.  I don't understand the negative reviews. What do these people want from a neighborhood taco shop with great food n nice people.  I love this place n hope everyone that works there is as happy as me when I get my favorite food at great prices. Just go give them a try. Get the California. N be nice when you go in n maybe it will be a better experience for you.   

I think I miss read one lol.  Anyway this place rocks!!!

I love the authentic flavors and especially the fried tacos!   This Little "hole in the wall" restaurant   is yummy .  Ask them for a side of chips and you will be pleased to find warmed tortilla chips that Are perfect... Love this place.  (No relation, despite my similar name.)

Laurita's is good standard Mexican food like Roberto's. I go to Laurita's at least once a week because I know the food is good and I know what to expect. I mainly get burritos and all have been good. I'd rather have Laurita's food over other fancy sit down Mexican places. It's better for a lot less money.
Best taco, nachos and burritos. Sucks they aren't 24/7 anymore. Roberto's is great but this place is better

The food taste good. Satisfying if your craving mexican and for that i gave it the two stars. It is the  horrible stomach issues that follow instantly upon finishing your meal that i must warn you about. I got small and simply three mini tacos( carna asada). There are simply the meat, tortillas and some onion and cilantro. No cheese no sour cream nothing that you would think would send your digestive system into complete melt down and enduring what can only be described with swear words and references to what occurs upon drinking third world water. I was not alone in my torture as my husband equally felt the cramps of botulism and headed for the bathroom upstairs as i claimed the one downstairs. I do not advise eating here if you plan to do anything other then stay close to a bathroom for the next 3 hours.

I live nearby and this place is an easy quick takeout. Last two times here I ordered BEEF enchiladas only to find nothing but cheese.  caught them the last time and ended up with the cheese ones for free.  just make sure you're getting what you order
great food and fast ,and cheap

Laurita's is way better than any of the Roberto's I've been too. Very authentic. Homemade everything. They have so much on the menu I haven't been able to try them all. Tacos and burritos are always great. Also with it being open 24 hours - huge plus for me and my crazy hours. I had a Carne Asada super burrito and loved it. The salsa was on point. Definitely going back!

After trying Roberto's many times and liking it, we discovered Laurita's...it's less than 5 mins from our house.  We are HOOKED on the Carne Asada Burritos...absolutely the best we've tasted since moving here from So Cal 6 yrs ago.  The meat is so tasty, the guacamole fresh and just the right amount of pico de gallo.  The tortilla is thin, like we like it...and it never falls apart.  The salsa's at the salsa bars are fresh, you can tell they replenish them often.  Such a simple, totally yummy burrito..we go often, probably too often and hardly ever want to try anything else.
Love this place. inexpensive, good quality food with friendly staff.

I love their carne asada nachos and they have some amazing salsas too. The reason why I gave it 4 stars is because it's always sooooo ridiculously hot in there you can never stay in to dine. Overall though good service and amazing food!!
I can't stop eating their crunchy tacos- I usually get beef. They have bomb tacos and I love their breakfast burritos as well. Service is always excellent as well. OPEN 24 HOURS!!

One of the hottest taco shop probably in southern Nevada. They must have about a hundred selections on the menu to choose from. I try only going there on my days off work but if I was not in the overwait area it would be three four times a week. Workers are awesome friendly. Always smile looks kind of like they enjoy working. Anyhow hands down to get yoir latin food fix

This place is the gem of Vegas!! For all your late night meals Laurita's California Burrito is affordable and darn good! If you are running low on cash/want a quick bite late at night, Laurita's is your place. Great menu options(over 20+) and service is prompt and courteous. The food feels authentic and makes you want to return after long days/nights on the Strip being open 24 hours a day. All day everyday meal status in Vegas!

Big fan of the breakfast burritos here and 24/7 availability! Salsa bar full of goodies too.

On a related note, I noticed the cook made sure to wash his hands each time he handled money. I'm super sensitive to hygiene and I appreciate the cleanliness of this place!

This place is awesome. Small place get very busy during lunch. Taco Tuesday can't beat.99 chicken tacos. Taste great!!  I'm here every Tuesday for the chicken tacos. I've eaten here numerous of times. Tried many things in the menu. I have not been disappointed on any item I've tried. I recommend this place for good Mexican food at a very reasonable price.

Great substitute for oxnard cali taco shops. Burrito size varys on who makes it! thats one thing i dont like... always ready for me 10mins after i call in my order.


wasn't great today. Dayshift cooks dont cook like laurita herself.

Have been going here for a few years because we live close by. The good news, my wife didn't like Mexican food until going here! Everything is made fresh and tastes fresh. The not so good news, is they are slacking off the last few months. My wife always gets a torta, but lately the meat has been cold and looks like it barely got half cooked the first time (we eat in the restaurant). I got the wet green burrito with chicken this time and they didn't bother draining the chicken so the burrito was very soupy! The "wet" is suppose to refer to the green sauce outside, not the meat inside! Was a 4.5 star for us before, hoping they step it up again. We'll let you know.
Anything with El Pastor (super flavorful pork) is crazy good here! Open 24 hours is a major plus! Service is great even at 3am. I do find my self adding salt to anything with asada here
I just had a steak big burrito at 5am on a Saturday morning. Disappointed with how it came out. No flavor, burrito tasted like it was siting there for 3 hours.
Rotten food, rotten staff, you will need a stomach pump after eating here, stick to Taco Bell in this price range.

This place is close and cheap. 

What more do you want? 

Alright,  I guess cleanliness and tasty food are musts as well. This restaurant has all of that. The food is great for what you're paying for and is cheap. It's not gourmet food by any means,  but it is good and great for a college student budget.  

Steer clear of the obvious American items mainly to please the people oblivious of Mexican cuisine and you're good to go. 

Definitely craving some Al pastor right now.

I am from out of town, stopped for burrito's. Wow! Beef, bean, cheese and rice. One carne asada, one shredded beef with salsa.  Wow! My grandson gave his a 5 thumbs up, me too. I'll try some more of their menu next time. Not so fancy, just great food. Perfect.

Wow! Can't believe I am writing this review after coming here and being extremely satisfied with service, quality of employees and quality of food. I have been coming here for years so often that people know me and recognize me and can pretty much order without me telling them what I want. 

Today changes that and sadly I will no longer be able to come back. As I walked into the restaurant today one of the cooks was in the front getting a drink. As soon as I walked in he looked at me and yelled "gringo" to the back cooks. Everyone started laughing and he couldn't keep a smile off his face. Instead of me reacting how I wanted and ripping his half toothless face off of his racist head I just looked at him in disbelief and ordered my food. The guy that is usually running the show here didn't seem too happy. Understandably. This is very unfortunate for the reputation of their company and honostly, owning a marketing company I could probably do some damage but I won't because I'm sure the owner of this company doesn't put up with that sort of nonsense. 

Hopefully they will do something about this racist working for them and all the racist that thought that was funny. It's kinda weird that racism would come from some hispanics especially with the country the way it is. Guess there are just shitty ass people in all walks of life. Too bad.

This place has inhuman size portions. It is not too salty. Much more authentic than its competition. Very inexpensive as well. My family enjoyed the food. The service was very quick.  I will probably never go to Super Burrito again thanks to Laurita's.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!
This is my favorite burrito place. They are better than Roberto's especially with their customer service. They make the most amazing California burrito with al pastor. Heck Roberto's will not do that, they make no substitutions at least the one on Bermuda and Cactus won't, even if your willing to pay extra. They make Don Tortaco look like del taco with the way their food is top quality and worth every penny!  The carne Asada fries are legit! Get there, you won't be sorry.

Been coming here for years. This place is definitely a step above a Roberto's but not exactly the best mexican food. Though in the area it is probably the best bang for your buck. My husband is from San Diego so he's tasted enough mexican fast food that are not chains. He has frequently said this offers pretty good food and easily rivals SD mexican fast food. 

We always get nachos, al pastor plate, and/or cali burrito. Our nachos have always came out pretty good. Sometimes they do put too much cheese but at least they always put a generous amount of meats.
I love their rice bowl! It taste sooooo amazing! Its very affordable and if you taste it you will surely come back here again... Keep it up!

We pass this place all the time so, we finally checked it out. When we first walked in we were hit by either smell of incense or a very powerful cologne!! So needless to say did not smell like Mexican food and we almost walked out due to my husband not being able to handle it with his Asthma. Thats how bad it was.
Needless to say we did place an order. The person at the counter was nice and they were kinda busy. We ordered 3 rolled tacos with guac. 3 bean and cheese burritos 1 bean rice and cheese burrito and 2 drinks.
We sat down to wait. They could up date or fix up the area we sit in and they could clean up the Salsa bar. But as we waited more and more people came in.
I loved my rolled tacos chicken with guac. The guac had flavor to it and it was great. My husband loved his burritos especially the homemade flour tort. Im picky about my refried beans and me personally not sure if i like theres! But we will try it again and i will decide. I can say the green salsa is really good

Straight bomb Mexican food! Everything I have had here is the bomb. The chimichangas are on point. The Laurtia burrito is as big as your arm.... The street tacos are like the ones in TJ. The prices are even close to Taco Bell so why not get the real deal.
Love this place! Cheap and good, what the hell else could you want? Best breakfast burritos anywhere.

I really wanted to be able to give this place a better review but I just can't.  I gave it multiple visits.  I tried - I really did.  But, in the end there're two reasons for where I eventually came out on this, those being the food and the nickle and dime attitude.  First, regarding the food, there are some things that this place does well.  For example, the carne asada is generally prepped well so that you don't get a lot of gristle and "carne de miscellaneous" in it.  That's a good thing.  Also, their regular quesadilla is very tasty and is reasonably priced for what you get.  Finally, I like their hot sauce (salsa roja).  On the other hand, their beans are a flavorless failure.  Their carnitas ooze enough grease to make the Exxon Valdez look like a Sierra Club member's kayak.  And, they fry off their tacos in oil at the wrong temperature so that the tacos emerge having sucked up so much oil that they're reminiscent of something that's been fracked out of the Bakken Shale.  Worse, to me though, is the nickel and dime approach which is just insulting in a town like Las Vegas.  For example, you only get one refill of your soda, which soda is priced about 50% above other similar places.  For further refills, you apparently have to buy a whole new soda.  Also, if you want to make any modifications to your order, be prepared to bleed for them.  For example, the upcharge for onions (onions!) on an item is 60 cents.  Thus, while the base price of a particular item might be fine, if you want to change anything, the add-ons and upcharges bear zero resemblance to the actual cost of the addition or modification.  In the end, between the hit-or-miss inconsistency of the food and the tacky, "bang-the-customer" attitude, I'm sorry, but two stars is the very best that I can do.

I used to love this place until they started to close at 12am. I work late so I get off of work late and try to go get some food but they're closed. Yet they're signing up front says 24 hours open. False advertisement. They need to take down that stupid sign.
Fresh and delicious every single time! Love the rolled tacos with chicken.

Identical to Robertos... You get what you pay for and it's pretty damn cheap so don't understand some of the complaints here.  Great for a quick fix and that's really it...  Wife usually orders the fish tacos and I normally get either the carne asada fries or nachos.  Both seem on par for an $8 meal.  If you're looking for a little more...  suck it up and drive to Cafe Rio.
Use to be a roberto's, but now they ae much cleaner and the food seems to be much better.  Friendly people and fast service.

The BEST Mexican food I have had yet in Las Vegas! 
I had a tamale and the rolled tacos.
The tamale came dressed up with sauce, cheese, tomato and other goodies! Very yummy! 
The rolled tacos were also very delicious and filling!
Would totally come back again!

I like that they have taco Tuesday. $1 chicken or potato tacos. The chicken tacos are ok.... the potato tacos are tasty.
But I'd rather pay more than double for their shredded beef tacos. Those are much better! 
Their beans and rice are good. 
Service is just like another taco shop, people hardly speak English, it's a walk up counter like fast food. Well that's what this is, Mexican fast food.

This place is terribly inconsistent on hours... 
First of all, it seems like bad luck that every time I choose to get late night tacos at this advertised 24/7 taco shop, they happen to be closed... worst of all, it's not like I am showing up at 4 am. It is currently 1:20am and now I am on my way to Robertos.

After pondering whether to go to Roberto's or try out Laurita's my wife and I finally landed on trying a new hole in the wall. We were very happy with the results. 

If you've read my Mexican Food reviews in the past you will know that the key to my heart is through a bean & cheese burrito. Something so simple can often times go so bad. It's a travesty really. I wasn't sure what to expect from Laurita's. The establishment itself used to be a Roberto's and still sports some of the old Roberto's attire. Fortunately, their bean burrito isn't anything like Roberto's. 

They have numerous specials at ridonkulously cheap prices. A coke, bean & cheese burrito, and a churro for the mere price of $3.99. Holy guacamole is that cheap! The beans are very good, the burritto could have used some extra cheese (since I did pay for extra cheese). The beans were piping hot and the burrito was massive. I could barely finish it. Top it off with a churro that was just a notch below a Disneyland churro and now we're talking a good meal. My wife had the wet bean & cheese burrito. She definitely liked it, personally I didn't care for the enchilada sauce (I prefer more of the cherry red colored sauce, this one was a little darker - but not bad according to her). 

The service was surprisingly good. Can't say I've had too much good service at Taco Shops, but the gentleman running the register, filling drinks, and providing refills was exceptionally friendly. Much appreciated! 

I'll definitely be back to burrito it up at Laurita's.

So my girl squad and I (yes that's what we ourselves, lame I know) try to come here for taco Tuesday every chance that we can get, mainly because it brings back so much memories. Anyway enough with the sappy stuff. I'm not the biggest fan of the environment itself, sometimes there's not enough enough tables/booths, it could be messy at times but the workers are always so quick to clean everything up once they get the chance. It does get busy here but that just goes to show that this is the go-to place because it's convenient, the prices are inexpensive, and it's just a quick bite for some yummy Mexican food! I would recommend get the California burrito, the street tacos, or the carne asada fries..but don't forget the green sauce; it's the best stuff out there!!


Tuesday special: $1.00 for hard shell potato or chicken taco. They're both delicious! A little greasy...but it's still good. Also, heads up... it's not 24/7 as the sign advertises.

Best pescado taco I have had in town! The prices are fantastic for the quality of ingredients and the portions. The veggie bar carrots and cucumbers were so fresh! The homemade sauces were super tasty. Very impressed. So much better than yucky Robertos. Will be going back soon.

This place has good chimichangas and burritos, but the tacos are not so great. The staff is quick, but sometimes not attentive to special requests. There have been several times where I have asked for no guacamole, and I still received it.

I always get the chicken chimichanga platter and I'm never disappointed. It is now my go-to place in the middle of the night instead of Don tortaco, which I am sad to say offered very wet, soaked dribbling burritos the last few times I was there. Cleanliness is OK. Service is pretty good. Doesn't take long to get my food.
Love the $1 chicken taco deal on Tuesdays. They are tasty and a great deal. The dining area is small but they serve em up fast. Will keep coming back.

Its alright. Honestly, its no different from Robertos, Filibertos, or any other -bertos I've been to. 

That being said, it's fine food for when you're craving filling food at a late hour....or any hour for that matter, as they are open 24 hours every day.

It's right by my house, so I've been there twice in the past 2 weeks. One time I got a chicken burrito and the meat was rather dry, but the next time I got the carne asada and that was freakin' tasty! 

This is the kind of place where a 3 star rating is perfect. It's not great, yet not horrible either. It falls pretty much right in the middle. It's good for what it is, though and I will be back.
Yum!  Potato taco?  Who'd have thought??!!  It's great!!  Everything is cooked fresh and is delicious!!
Reliable. Open 24/7. Great prices and the staff are friendly. Food comes out fast, how fast you say? When you're done choosing hot sauces and packing em up your food is ready.

What can you say about Laurita's? The food is great and cheap. It's open 24 hours. When you're in the mood for Mexican food and you're in this area, choose Laurita's over Don Tortaco up the street (it's supposed to be open 24 hours, but I've been twice now after midnight only to find the door locked with all of the lights on). Laurita's is great if you want something crazy, like carne asada fries, or something simple, I suggest the bean and wet cheese burrito with sour cream and rice inside. I love this place.
The carne asada anything is awesome; burritos, tacos, nachos...love the flavor and quality of the meat!

Love this place. Like a Roberto's, but a bit more personable (and it's close to my house). They'll make a costumized breakfast burrito and I can call it in. It'd get 5 stars if they had fresh brewed iced tea...
Service is fast, the salsa bar is stocked and the food is inexpensive and hot. The crowd is moving quickly this Tuesday night.

I tried this place out today when I was looking for a cheap, quick Mexican joint and it was actually pretty damn good. 

I had the El Pastor Plate ($7.50), which usually comes with rice, beans, lettuce and tortillas, but I opted to go without the beans or lettuce. The meat was very juicy with a fantastic flavor, as was the rice. The tortilla was piping hot and I made myself some nice miniature tacos.

I also ordered a side of chips ($1) and tried out one of the salsas. Whichever one I picked was delicious. It was the red one that didn't have seeds in it. The perfect amount of spice without being so hot that there's no flavor.

I would definitely say I enjoyed this place far more than Don Tortaco, Roberto's, Fillipito's, Tacos El Gordo, Tacos Mexico...the list goes on and on. Definitely my favorite taco shop.

It's pretty much Roberto's without the convenience of the drive thru. We Yelped other Mexican places and came across Laurita's.

My husband had a Carnita's Tacos plate and I just had cheese with tortilla chips. I know boring but I ate waaay too much in Vegas and I just wanted a snack. My husband said he prefers the beans at Roberto's. The cleanliness was meh but heck it is cheap and a little hole in the wall. Tacos were good and prices were decent.

Nice little change from Roberto's.

This is definitely one of my favorite late night, bad decision dining choices. I love the rolled beef tacos smothered in guacamole and cheese. Carne Asada tacos or tostada. The carne Asada nachos are awesome, but you need someone to share them. The green sauce salsa is my favorite. I could almost drink it. I eat here often enough but I never really thought about writing a review. I mean everyone knows what they are getting with a place like this, but the last time I was there, I changed my mind. The counter guy seriously washed his hands at least 3 times while I was there. I was the only customer. I was very impressed with this excellent display of good sanitation. He washed his hands before he took my order, after he took my order and again before he handed me my food. Cleanliness like this really makes me confident in a place.

Seems like a carbon copy of Roberto's or Don Tortaco. Cheap, tasty mexican food. I would give it more stars IF there was ever a clean table in the place. Seems like everytime I go in there is crumbled up taco all over the table or seats. I also wish that their enchilada sauce had a little more pep in its step and the cheese on the inside was actually melted. You can't go wrong with chicken tacos or rolled tacos tho! Summer yummy.

Used to come here ALL the time since it was the only local 24/7 taco shop in the neighborhood. Came here tonight because it was in my way home and thought they stepped it up a notch since Don DorTacos moved two blocks down. NOPE, more of a disappointment. Not only dirty as usual and food bad as usual but the dude at the counter couldn't even walk three steps more to serve me and make me come get my "to stay order." LIVE AND LEARN. The condiment counter, bathroom, floors and service counter filthy more than usual. Whoa, yes my fault on trying to give this place another try but perhaps time to contact dirty dining to save others!!!

Worst tacos Ever!!!!!
Beef doesn't tasted anything,  all lettuce and jalape√±os !! I wasted 13.80 for this tacos!! Can't even eat it properly because tortilla is soggy!

This is place is very close to us, we have been fans since we move to this area, it's open 24/7 and everything that we order normally is good.

Our favorite: Order 3 Flautas, Mini Tacos, sopes, Huarache and Torta de Asada and Carnitas.

I actually think this place is pretty good. The salsa bar is pretty good. I usually get a breakfast burrito or carne asada tacos. The service is always fast and friendly. The bathrooms are pretty clean. for the price and the convenience you can't really complain. it's not fancy but the food is pretty consistent and flavorful.

Formerly known as Robertos, Lauritas is solid Mexican fast food. They basically have the same exact menu as Robertos but they feature some less expensive options. The carne asada nachos are still my personal favorite. Quick service and simple menu makes this an easy 4 star rating.
This place has never let me down. the food is fresh and quick. I usually order the California burrito but last time i ordered the three tacos and chips. Still delicious, inexpensive AND open 24/7.

I did not like it.
I was told, "this is real Mexican food". 
Well, I've been to Mexico and it does not taste like this.
Worst chile relleno I have ever eaten. I didn't even finish it. And that never happens. 
Weird taste. Bad sauce.
Beans and rice were all I could get down.
The salsa bar was not appealing either. 
I would never tell a friend they had to eat at this place.
CARNE ASADA  nAchos are the best around 4:20. Are lil secret.  Especially when blazed off the Medical MJ!!!

Best burritos like the CA burrito & the classic breakfast burrito. 
These guys have been here a while, we were one of the their first customers back when they belonged to the greedy corporate "Rberto's". 
They ventured off on their own after severing ties with them and now they have made a name for themselves. 
Customer service is always good.

Usually I get my breakfast burritos from Roberto's however they are mostly potato and the potatoes are mushy. I heard about this place located near my house and decided to try it out.

I was very impressed. The place was clean and they have a huge menu.

I ordered the menudo(to die for only served on weekends), Huevos Rancheros(eggs were cooked perfectly and the sauce was amazing) and a bacon breakfast burrito which was mostly eggs.

I will be back!!!
I love the food here. Good prices. Fast service.  Taco Tuesday is great too $1 tacos. I like to get the chimichangas here. Good sauces too. Authentic.

I have only had the Breakfast Burrito. It was below average. it had very little taste was greasy and the potatoes they put in it were almost mashed. I will give them another shot cause they are close to my house but with so many options in the area I don't think they will make they cut.

Open 24 hours a day! Can you say anytime munchies fulfilled?

Been here several time to get some quick grub, the prices are kinda high for a Mexican place of this type/style. I normally get the tacos combo, and the tacos had very little substance in it except for a large piece of flour tortilla, and the flavors is very mediocre. The tables are not very clean, and neither is the floor. 

Service is fast and efficient but that's about it.

Whenever I get those late night cravings or after a night of drinking, my boyfriend and I always come here for some good food. 

The interior is small, but from what I've seen, it's always been clean. The staff is friendly and food comes out quick. I always get the carne asada nachos and I have never been disappointed. Don't forget to grab some pickled jalapenos and carrots, they're always fresh and crunchy. 

Laurita's beats Roberto's, hands down.

I ordered 5 mini tacos at like 11PM and my tortillas were super hard and crusty. The meat was decent, but what is a taco without the tortilla?

Probably never going to eat here again unless I'm hungry late and night and there's no other option.
Not 24 hours change your signs and info on website. Also you have signs all over your building showing 24 Horus but your not.

This place has delicious breakfast burritos... huuuuuuuuuuge breakfast burritos. The have a variety of different breakfast burritos, so many ti choose from. They use fresh vegetables, real meat, and all fresh ingredients. The Burritos are soooooo good and sooooooo filling! I would eat them all day everyday if I could... the one reason it didnt get the 5th Star... is the price... its not over the top expensive... but just a tad bit for breakfast. Its not that expensive, again... only a tad bit ... Oh, well and they dont have breakfast tacos, at least thts wht the guy said... only Breakfast Burritos I'd definitely recommend it for those looking for great breakfast burritos!

This place seriously sucks.  I mean seriously.  I've given it many tries (late night only thing open near by) and disappointed every time.  I've received tacos that definitely sat on a heat plate until the tortilla was rubber.  The chicken tastes like it's out of a can.  The carne asada is flavorless cardboard..  I would suggest going elsewhere.  Even Del Taco would be better.

Hole in the wall. As basic and straight forward as one Mexican taco shop can be. I like the Tacos on Tuesday. Great taste, great price. This is the type  of place that you have a taste: Dont get carried away...

I really like this place!  The food is so good and fast.  I think the longest we've waited is about 10 minutes to get our food...I would strongly suggest the carne asada plate.  Awesome meat!  There is guacamole on the side, along with rice, beans, and tortillas.  Can't go wrong!  

It's kind of a random location off of Maryland and Pebble...just look right behind/next to the Shell Station and you'll see it.

My husband and younger daughter just really love this little taqueria place and a couple times a month go there after training at Dunham Jiujitsu next door. 
We went there tonight at the request of my daughter and her fellow jiujitsu pal after practice. It's no bells and whistles, just straight up Mexican taqueria. Tacos, taquitos, burritos, tortas, etc. 
I must say the chicken street tacos I had were better than the first time, cilantro and onions, I get a side of avocado, they were pretty good. My daughter loves the chicken torta (you can get it as a combo with fries and a drink if you want). 
Total for three street tacos, a torts combo, a 5 beef taquito combo was $22. 
The guys who work there are always super nice, their English is not that bueno, so I order in Spanish.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!  The food is always amazing, and hot and super yummy!  I've visited this establishment multiple times at different hours of the day and have always had amazing service and amazing food!  This is my go to place for mexican food!!  hands down in looooooove!
Always a good stop late at night. Rosa Maria's in San Bernardino is the only better spot.

This has basically the same menu as the other taco shops in the neighborhood, but the quality is much, much better. I have a place with a drive thru closer to my home, but I drive over here and get out of the car instead, because the quality is so much better. I personally like the quesadilla and the nachos with grilled chicken. I also like the breakfast burrito with chorizo. My wife likes the adobada and carne asada. The employees are very nice here and the salsa bar clean and inviting. The muted green salsa is perfect on the chorizo.

Really good taco shop for Las Vegas standards (obviously not as good as a San Diego taco shop).  Open 24 hours.

I had a quesadilla and 5 rolled tacos.  Food was cooked up really really quick.  Tables inside are clean.

The quesadilla was very cheesy and very buttery.  Delicious.  Tortilla was a tad bit rubbery, but not nearly as bad as most taco shops around town.

The rolled tacos were great.  A bit big too.  They were crispy without being overcooked.  Guacamole was slightly above average.

This review is long overdue! After many drunk nights and cheat days, I've resorted to this delicious place for comfort. 

Laurita's is comparable to Roberto's, but just so much better. The menu is pretty much the same as well with tacos, burritos, enchiladas and all that delicious fatty goodness. They load their burritos with more meat. Their taco shells are crunchy and not break-your-teeth-hard like Roberto's. My food isn't dripping in grease either. I already know that this food isn't good for you, so I don't need to see the big oil puddle. And besides the typical red and green salsa, Laurita's also has this avocado/cilantro salsa that is freaking delicious!! I always get 4 or 5 little containers of just that salsa and drench all my food in it. Food always comes out quickly. 

I'm a huge fan of this place and I'll definitely be back.

Got the carne asada fries. I asked him to put the guac on the side but he put the sour cream on the side instead. Not a big deal though. Other than that the fries were ok. I also got carnitas tacos. The meat was a little burnt and the tortillas were thin and tasted like flour. I prefer corn myself. I went here because my favorite taco shop was closed. It wasn't terrible but it wasnt good. I dont know if ill go back.
Good food, quick service. Only downside are the tables, half of them are nearly falling off.

This place is a gem! Tacos are amazing, service is prompt,  and the portions are generous! I got a couple of carne asada tacos and a soda, they have amazing pico de Gallo! Definitely a great place to stop in and grab a bite. Gave it 4 stars because they gave me chicken in one of my tacos Lol. A million times better than Robertos (starting to find out that a lot of places are better than Roberto's ). Recommend this place wholeheartedly.

Not really sure what to say about this place. It's exactly what you expect. It's pretty much robertos. Everyone I  Vegas knows these types of places. If your hungry for Mexican and want a good amount if food especially if your drunk this is the place to go. The food tastes great, the amount of food is great, and they make your order pretty fast. I'll keep coming back here

Most Mexican places I go I only stick to one or two items on the menu, but I try something different every time I come here and it's always delicious! Want to get full on the cheap? You've come to the right way place and the best part is they're 24 hours!

Their carne asada is gristly for my taste (the only thing I took a star off for). I know that's typical of these places though.

I was craving some mexican food the other day & went to Roberto's which is now called Laurita's. I go inside and it smells spicy! Yum! Order up a chimichanga plate with an extra side of rice. Got it home and it was HUGE. It seriously took me 3 days to eat this thing.
I dont usually eat much ethnic food but I have to say this was not bad..it was not the best I ever ate but is sure beats Taco Bell. LOL

Love their $.99 Taco Tuesdays!  Everyone is pretty nice and accommodating!   As for the side hot sauces etc they need to rotate it more often & refresh! Every time I go I end up w an empty salsa container & a few cucumbers left in container. Still one of my quick spots that have tacos!

This place is good, I love the chicken tacos! The salsas taste a bit watered down , but I like that they have cucumbers. Everything I've had has tasted good, my only advice for them would be that when a customer is ordering, don't drop them from ordering and start placing an order for someone on the phone and put their order in first. Put them on hold and  go first ordering, rather than phone getting priority. Otherwise, I do like this place!

Horrible! First I had never heard of this place and it is close to home. I wanted so bad to find a great Taco Shop and stumbled across this location. There were no cars in the parking lot and I was at first a little leery but since it was a Sunday, I figured that I would just give it a shot.  

When you first walk in there are 2 things that you are immediately overwhelmed by. 1st, the extremely extensive menu and 2nd, the extremely excessive heat. I do not believe that they had the AC on and it was 107 degrees outside, it had to bean easily 120 degrees inside. 

The instant I walked in I was greeted by the guy behind the counter, he immediately demanded my order since I was interrupting he and his coworkers conversation. I asked for a minute so I could review the extensive menu.  He took a step away from me and regained his conversation with his coworkers.  After a couple seconds he barks at me, "What is your order" in his broken english. I explained that this was my first time and I needed a minute to review the menu, I decided on the 6 rolled tacos and instead of sour cream I asked for extra guacamole. The guy behind the counter explained that it already comes with guacamole. I explained that I wanted extra, which I was charged extra for it.  Two customers came in behind me who were clearly Mexican and placed their order in Spanish. The received their drinks before I did, and their burritos before I received my order. The did not call ahead either. The workers did not realize that I also am Hispanic because I appear to be very Caucasian. I finally asked for my drink and after several more minutes my order was given to me. The guy who took my order asked the "chef" if there was extra guacamole in spanish which the "chef" responded no. I immediately opened the container and said "I paid for extra guacamole, why would you not give me what I paid for?"  I then explained that my complete name which is extremely hispanic and that I understood exactly what they said, they were both in shock.  The "chef" decided to finally put some more guacamole on my order.  

Since it was so unbearably hot here, I decided to take my order to go, I live about 5 minutes away and by the time I arrived home, my "rolled tacos" which were nothing more than pre-made frozen Taquitos, they were not even fully cooked.  

What a huge disappointment this place was and I would never eat here, nor recommend it to anyone.

Went today and had a bean and cheese burrito. It was really good. Better than Fausto's and Roberto's. Plus the place smelled and looked clean. Can't wait to go back to try the huevos rancheros and flautas!

My husband and I were looking for mexican food outside of the Las Vegas strip. We are from San Diego county, land of the taco shop on almost every corner. We have plenty of Roberto's taco shops, so we wanted to try something new. Our GPS found this one close to the area we were driving so we gave it a chance. The food was good, I had a California Burrito and he had the Carne Asada Burrito. The meat was seasoned appropriately and the portions were a good size. The only thing that lost it for me was their aguas. (jamaica, tamarindo, orchata) Most people don't care about the kind of drink they buy with their meal. But I do. I don't care for that Ole brand of aguas, but I rather drink that than soda. I ordered their version of Jamaica and the water had a very gross taste to it. Not sure if they have cleaned their fountain drink filters lately. But I was turned off by the taste of the drink. It tasted like the water was stale and if a goat bathed in it.
I did like the food overall, & next time I'll just order a soda and deal it with it.

I am not sure how the Las vegas version of Roberto's is but we may try that place next time.

Ordered the chicken chimichanga plate , comes with a chicken chimichanga with sour cream on one end and guacamole on the other along with shredded cheese on top (incredibly juicy and flavorful). Also comes with a side of rice and refried beans ! (If you get the plate , if you don't then you only get the chimichanga . SUPER GOOD and will continue to go back !! Love the red and green sauce . Highly recommend ! Can't go wrong with a chimichanga

Like Roberto's, but better food!  Best chile relleno I've had since L.A. 20 years ago.  They get horchata right too:  Not too watery.  It might seem silly, but more than half the time I've been to Roberto's the horchata is too watered down.   Great hot sauces at the sauce and vegetable bar.  Beef burritos have lots of onions and green pepper --  I like them that way, but if you don't,  then you'll probably want them to hold the peppers and/or onions.  Counter s staff are always friendly and helpful, unlike Roberto's.  There's a reason every time I come in here there's always locals ordering.  They do a taco shop the way it ought to be done!

Love this place, better than Robertos!

I love everything.  The workers are friendly, there jalapenos and carrot mix is the bomb.com!
Take 24/7 off this place. Multiple times, I understand it's late but don't false advertise. 3am and only one light on with door locked.

This is a good Mexican food stop if you're the type to have late night cravings. I used to come here at 1/2 in the morning and there would be only one person running the restaurant. They run with only one person overnight so be patient or go elsewhere if you're looking for quick food. I ordered their carne asada fries and California burrito. Both was good and portioning is big so you'll guarantee (unless you're hella hungry) will have leftovers. Both items would be about $20. Their drinks are not free refill, you'd have to pay to fill up your drink and their cup as are practically medium sized so I don't recommend getting it. There's a condiment bar on your left side from the counter where you could take home chives, limes, sauces, etc. At night the tables are left dirty but I understand because there's literally only one person cooking the food, working as a cashier, refilling up the condiment bar, and bussing tables. I wish they had one other person working to ease the load and wait time here.

I go to this place because they have a chicken plate like the Carne asada plate. Very good and fresh 24 hours can't beat that.. I would check this place out you will like it better than don tortaco or robertos

Ordered to go food. Came home and half way thru my son had a metal piece in his mouth. I called them to let them know and the guys response was What's wrong with that? Well that set me off! A simple apology would have sufficed but to say what he said?!? Is ridiculous! If you want a little more iron in your diet EAT HERE. WTF!  Wish I didn't have to put a star up but I wanted to post!

One step above Taco Bell and Del Taco, but not a sit down style restaurant. When looking for cheap, greasy eats at 2am in the morning, this joint hits the spots. I am not sure what the difference is between Laurita's and Roberto's, because it all taste the same and I do not mean that in a bad way. 

The rolled tacos smothered in guacamole never fails to satisfy and for five dollars, it is affordable. Add another dollar to make it a combo with a drink. The salsas do not have a distinct flavor, but the pickled vegetables are delicious.
First time here. Had the Asada rice bowl. Big portion. Pretty good. I will be back to try some other healthier menu items that I saw.

The food didn't top my list of great mexican food, but it did the job to satisfy my late night cravings. The place was run down, dingy and sauces were all but half empty when I filled up on some to take home. Definitely wouldn't have stayed to eat. Order before you arrive and save yourselves the hassle.

I don't know if the fact I was sober, or read previous reviews caused my visit to Laurita's to be so disappointing.

I was hungry, craving enchiladas, driving around aimlessly, we checked Yelp and decided to try Laurita's, after reading all of the reviews about their "cheap, amazing food."

Looking at the menu, the "cheap" part of the reviews was instantly disproved. Figuring we were hungry, there already, and willing to try it, we went ahead and ordered. 

My wife's order went through pretty much without a hitch. I tried ordering my food, then asked a question about how much a side of rice was. The cashier's mind went on the fritz and couldn't grasp that I wanted two plates of food and a side of rice. She kept asking questions in a circular conversation. I had to just walk away.

My wife attempted to pay with her card. Their machine asked them to input the last four digits of the card. What did they input? Nearly every combination BUT the last four. I will explain. Let's say this is the card #: 
ABCD EFGHIJ KLMNO

They entered KLMN (three times).
They entered the four digit security code once
They also entered IJKL, JKLM and perhaps even GHIJ.

This should have been a major red flag. If you can't count to four, how can you properly prepare our food?

Our food was brought out, and I attacked it with the fervor of a cheetah on an African savannah, Impala in it's grasp.

Once more, the Disappointment-O-Meter jumped through the roof. When I order cheese enchiladas, I would like cheese enchiladas; not, shredded cheese wrapped in a corn tortilla, drenched in sauce, and with a splash of melted cheese on the top. If I wanted to eat a tortilla filled with cold, shredded cheese, I don't need to pay $2.50 each for that.

The chicken enchilada was a little better, however, after such a weak offering in the cheese enchilada arena, Laurita would need to have served me a mind blowing pair of chicken enchiladas to make up for it. 

Their food was mediocre at best. I can see how drunk people may think it is amazing. Then again, you could feed some Vegas drunks from a dumpster and get the same reaction.

If you want overpriced, bad, undercooked food, with extreme frustration when attempting to order and pay, go to Laurita's.

Love this place.  Each time I come here I try something new on the menu and have not been disappointed.  Everything is great.  So far my favorites are the Al Pastor Tacos and the Chicarones (sp) 
Great food, great prices, and friendly service.

This is my third visit. First two were alright. Last visit was a disaster. Carne Asada had hard fat pieces chewy. Orchata drink was powdery and tasted like bleach. Bathroom was graffiti all over. Salsa was old never go back

I have tried many dishes and have enjoyed them all (favorite is the carne asada burrito). Prices are easily affordable and you get plenty for your money.  The restaurant is small but they keep it clean. Nice place to go for a quick, filling meal.

I classify this type of Mexican spots by my level of soberness or drunkness however you rather call it my party people. Laurita is on the "damn im drunk and need food asap" category.. Not as low as robertos " FOOD NOW cause regardless im gonna vomit it" category but down there. And its not a bad thing trust me ..its just not the food for me.

Their portions are big and generous but not high on quality. But we both know that this place is not aiming for 5 stars..The "damn im drunk and need to eat asap" crowd usually shows up late and they love it. But for me, that rather enjoy a little more quality ..its just ok

The flavor is decent. Its not bad at all , but sometimes its greasy and just kinda have that industrially line cooked kinda flavor but for the price you cant complain. It is a good choice when either your liver is crying for food or when your pocket is thin.

The location is very centric and clean. Food comes fast and their menu is extensive giving you almost innumerable amounts of combos!. To top this their prices are great . Inexpensive and a lot of food is what some people look for and at Lauritas you can find it.

This my first review, but have eaten here before. Stay away from the nachos, all they do is melt cheddar cheese over chips so, when the chips and cheese get hard they get stuck together and cheese is soon oily. The Chicken Chimichanga is very good. yummy with sour cream of course. 
Going to try there tacos today, not your typical taco bell. Made with real tortilla.

I'm from out of town and was craving a breakfast burrito. I found this place and was satisfied and impressed 
I ordered a breakfast burrito with egg whites and carne asada ($6.65) and it was one big burrito. Very flavorful and stuffed well. 
Yay for good Mexican food!

We have another fantastic early lunch everybody in this location is super nice and friendly even there is no open 24 hours anymore still good day other than today anyways only came here late night when I'm drunk like everybody else and assume now they're remodeling the outside

We are new to the area and were excited to find a place close by that was open 24/7. We stopped by tonight and it was closed... apartment not open 24/7 every day? Anyone have any insight? Disappointed and possibly not coming back if hours aren't consistent...
I love going to this place! The chicken quesadilla is Uber yummy! Just up the street it's great!

I thought we had already found a go to taco shop until we drove up to Laurita's.  Even the parking lot smells good from all the carne they're grilling up!  The California Burrito is the best we've had so far.  Instead of just grilling the meat, it's seasoned and comes hot, cheesy, with fillings galore.  My favorite part of it were the chunks of potatoes.  This burrito really hit the spot.  It's good for late night eats or to 'cure' a hangover.  I will definitely be back!
It's 99% the same as Roberto's. Same people, food, smell, prices. Just a different sign.

First of all, I am not one to complain about food service. 99% of the reviews I write are positive because I am a small restaurant owner and I understand what bad publicity can do for a business... That being said; I was just at Lauritas for the 50th time and today, while the food was as passable as any "Robertos" would be, the service must be the reason for my grievance. I was waiting in the car while my husband ordered 1 burrito ($6 with tax) 1 set of (3) rolled tacos ($6) and 1 order of fried chicken wings ($10). I was charged $30 and then we did not receive a receipt. The clerk made it sound as if he didn't print the receipt with the transaction, that it was lost. I called a few minutes later to speak with him and he hung up on me after I asked him to ring up those items and tell me the cost with tax. Then I called a second time, this time I spoke in fluent Spanish to ease the language barrier . He hung up a second time. I called a third time and explained that if I need this remedied and he said 'I am busy!' And hung up a third time. By the time I've spoken with a manger tomorrow (which I will), my pilfered moneys as well as many other people's is going directly into his pocket and not into the business who's name he is tarnishing. DO NOT EAT HERE!! THE FOOD IS SUB PAR AND YOULL GET RIPPED OFF!! Save yourself the trouble and go to ANY OTHER MEXICAN FOOD RESTAURANT ... They are more likely to at least charge you appropriately.
